thread.title: Bobby Jindal advisers make case for his inclusion on main debate stage
thread.title_full: Bobby Jindal advisers make case for his inclusion on main debate stage

title: Bobby Jindal advisers make case for his inclusion on main debate stage
text:
Bobby Jindal advisers make case for his inclusion on main debate stage Bobby Jindal advisers make case for his inclusion on main debate stage BY Elizabeth Crisp | ecrisp@theadvocate.com 
Louisiana Gov. Bobby Jindal’s advisers say his growing support in Iowa means he should be bumped up to the main stage when the Republican presidential candidates debate again Oct. 28. 
But without some form of intervention, Jindal appears headed back to another early “undercard debate.” 
During a media call on Tuesday Jindal campaign senior strategist Curt Anderson, campaign manager Timmy Teepell and pollster Wes Anderson argued that the current criteria for the CNBC debate neglects early states that will have the first say in the nominating process. Iowa’s caucuses are scheduled for Feb. 1, and Jindal has spent much of his time campaigning there since formally launching his bid in June. 
“A national survey is predictive of nothing except name ID at this point in the process,” Curt Anderson told reporters. 
CNBC’s rules rely on national polling. To appear in the 7 p.m. debate, a candidate must average at least 2.5 percent in NBC, ABC, CBS, Fox, CNN and Bloomberg polls conducted from Sept. 17 to Oct. 21. More On This Topic
